message.content: Yes, the authors state the full set of assumptions for all the theoretical results presented in the paper. The main assumptions can be found in the pretext of Theorem 1, and additional assumptions are included in the proofs and discussions of Lemma 1, Theorem 2, and the eigenvalue decay of integral operators. The authors provide a clear and detailed explanation of these assumptions, which contribute to the understanding of the paper's theoretical foundation.

Yes, the authors state the full set of assumptions of all theoretical results. The paper includes Theorem 1 with respective assumptions, which are clearly stated in the text. Additionally, the proof of Theorem 1 is provided in the appendix. The paper also discusses Lemma 1 and Theorem 2, both of which have their assumptions detailed. Overall, the authors are thorough in stating the assumptions for their theoretical results.

Yes, the authors state the full set of assumptions for all theoretical results presented in the paper, such as Theorem 1 and Theorem 2. They provide conditions and assumptions on the probability densities, kernel functions, and sample points as well as the eigenvalues of integral operators. The authors also provide proofs and explanations supporting their theoretical results in the appendix section.
